title: Write and add complete content for all site pages/sections

requirements.text: Add missing page/section content so every existing navigation/footer link target resolves to real, readable content: implement an About section with id="#about" and legal sections with ids "#privacy", "#terms", and "#cookies" (Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, Cookie Policy), and ensure these sections are included in the rendered layout.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the header "About" navigation scrolls to a visible About section with meaningful English copy (no placeholder/lorem ipsum).

Clicking footer legal links (Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, Cookie Policy) scrolls to corresponding sections that contain complete, readable policy text (headings + multi-paragraph content) in English.
There are no dead in-page links (no nav/footer link pointing to an id that does not exist in the DOM).

requirements.text: Rewrite and standardize marketing copy across all existing sections (Hero, Services, Proof/Metrics, Testimonials, Process, CTA, Footer) to be consistent in tone and branding for “AMS Digital Agency”, and ensure all user-facing text is clear, professional English (including buttons, headings, descriptions, trust indicators, stats labels, and helper text).
acceptanceCriteria: All visible text in HeroSection, ServicesSection, ProofSection, TestimonialsSection, ProcessSection, CtaSection, SiteHeader, and SiteFooter is coherent and consistently branded as AMS Digital Agency.
No section contains generic placeholder copy; all items in arrays (services, steps, metrics, testimonials, trust indicators, footer descriptions) read as intentional final content.
CTA form helper text, labels/placeholders, and button text remain clear and grammatical in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn/ui) or any other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep the application as a single React frontend (no additional backend services; backend/main.mo remains single-actor).
nonGoals: Adding a blog, CMS, or dynamic content management system.
Implementing real email capture/CRM integration for the CTA form submission.
Adding new product features beyond writing/adding page and section content.
